articles.title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Broadcom Soars on Reports of Apple AI Chip Tie-Up
articles.content: The S&P 500 gained 0.8% on Wednesday, Dec. 11, 2024, as data showed inflation remaining sticky but matching forecasts, bolstering rate-cut expectations.

articles.title: Apple sets fresh intraday high on AI updates, reported chip colalb
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) hit a record intraday high on Wednesday after announcing new artificial intelligence (AI) features amid a reported chip partnership with Broadcom (AVGO), according to reports from The Information. Intelligent Alpha founder and CEO Doug Clinton joins Asking for a Trend Host Josh Lipton to take a closer look at what sent Apple stock higher and where the iPhone maker stands in the AI era. Clinton says there are two things driving Apple stock higher. He explains, "First of all, I think the Magnificent Seven in general, we've had a pretty good period really since the election. We got past sort of the uncertainty about direction right at the top level for the country." "The second piece is specific to Apple. If you look at their business, I think that the iPhone numbers, and investors seem to realize this, for next year, are kind of de-risked. I mean, expectations are low... There's really no expectation for AI adding much of anything to Apple over the next year." On the reports of Apple working on a chip, Clinton says "Any company that is playing in the AI space that has over $1 billion market cap, we think, they have to develop their own silicon. It's just a matter of time for any of those companies who aren't doing it. Apple was obviously always involved in making their own silicon for their devices. Now, they're bringing that into the server and doing it for their particular use case in AI. I think it's a smart move by them, somewhat predictable, but it also shows, I think, that they are serious about AI." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

articles.title: Broadcom Stock Nears Buy Point On Apple AI Server Chip News
articles.content: Broadcom stock approached a buy point following news reports that the fabless chipmaker is designing an AI server chip for Apple.

articles.title: Apple Stock Hits Record High On Second Wave Of AI Features
articles.content: Apple stock notched a record high after the consumer electronics giant released its second batch of artificial intelligence features.

articles.title: Mag 7 will 'power through' markets in 2025: Strategist
articles.content: Roundhill Investments CEO David Mazza joins Market Domination Overtime to discuss why the Magnificent Seven stocks — Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — are positioned to outperform in markets in 2025. "People don't want to be on the wrong side of what has been, for two years, an incredibly impressive trade," he tells Yahoo Finance. Investors are returning to the Magnificent 7 names because these stocks provide both offensive and defensive strategies in the current market landscape. "These companies as a whole... really have impressive operating leverage," Mazza notes. With uncertainty surrounding potential tariffs and inflation in the upcoming year, investors are seeking companies that can "power through" economic challenges, which increasingly points them toward the Magnificent Seven. Despite this focus, Mazza adds: "I think there is a general sentiment that the economy is okay, and we have so much positive investor sentiment right now, and that to me is what's really pushing the market higher." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

articles.title: Apple working with Broadcom to create new AI chip: Report
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) is partnering with semiconductor manufacturer Broadcom (AVGO) to develop a new AI chip, according to a report by The Information. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley joins the Market Domination team to discuss this move for the iPhone maker as it just added OpenAI's ChatGPT to its device through the latest Apple Intelligence update. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
